title: OS Mods Definition Schema
description: Defines the structure of OS Mods to be properly referenced by the OS Mod Manager

id.description: Unique identifier of your mod. It should preferably be in Reverse Domain Name notation and the same as your Harmony/BepInEx mod identifier.

displayName.description: The name the end-user will see.

tagline.description: The slogan of your mod. It will appear near the title as a shorter description-like string.

description.description: The description of your mod. Currently unused.

owner.description: Your Github name as it appears in a URL or on your profile.

repository.description: The Github repository from which the releases should be taken from as it appears in the URL or in the title on the main page.

releases.description: Dictionary of release tags. The keys represent the game versions with which a certain tag is compatible. Tags should follow Semantic Versioning so the manager can properly validate the version and use it to compare to other versions.

dependencies.description: Array of unique mod identifiers which should be downloaded and loaded first.
